p: The hospital wastewater (HWW) is the effluents which are generated from all the hospital activities, such as surgery, emergency and first aids, laboratories, diagnosis, and radiology [1]. HWW is produced in a wide range. The quantity and characteristics of the HWW are varied mainly according to the size (big: >500 beds; middle: 100–499 beds; small: <100 beds) and the type (general or special) of the hospital [2]. It was reported that the generation rate of HWW was around 400–1000 L per bed per day worldwide [3], [4], [5].
